statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 2 \\ -2 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 2 \\ -2 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -12 \\ 6 \\ -6 \\ 3 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 18 \\ -3 \\ 3 \\ 9 \\ 12 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 2 \\ -2 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 2 \\ -2 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -12 \\ 6 \\ -6 \\ 3 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 18 \\ -3 \\ 3 \\ 9 \\ 12 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
